meanings.definition: The practice of performing ceremonies or rituals.
meanings.sent1: The tribal chief led the ceremonialism to honor the harvest.
meanings.sent2: The graduation ceremony was a beautiful display of ceremonialism.
meanings.sent3: The penguin's ceremonialism of bowing before diving into the water amused the zoo visitors.
meanings.sent4: The ceremonialism of the changing seasons reminds us of the cyclical nature of life.
meanings.sent5: The ceremonialism of the wedding vows made the moment unforgettable.

meanings.definition: Excessive adherence to formalities or rituals.
meanings.sent1: Her strict ceremonialism in following the rules sometimes annoyed her friends.
meanings.sent2: The company's ceremonialism in dress code made employees feel restricted.
meanings.sent3: The cat's ceremonialism in grooming every hour was comically obsessive.
meanings.sent4: His ceremonialism in always taking the same route to work became a metaphor for his resistance to change.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's ceremonialism in grading papers with a red pen became a symbol of authority in the classroom.
